answer: Use @regulatory-affairs (Dr. RÃ©gis) for classification, intended use, submissions, and regulatory strategy.
Use @regulatory-affairs /classify to determine SaMD classification (IMDRF, FDA, CE MDR, IEC 62304).
Use @regulatory-affairs /intended-use to draft the Intended Use document.
Use @risk-manager (Dr. Hana) for ISO 14971 risk management, FMEA, and risk evaluation.
Use @risk-manager /fmea to conduct a Failure Mode and Effects Analysis.
Use @clinical-evaluator (Dr. Claire) for clinical evaluation, validation plans, and statistical protocols.
Use @clinical-evaluator /validation-plan to design a clinical validation study.
Use @quality-manager /traceability to generate or verify the traceability matrix.
Use @quality-manager /phase-gate to run an IEC 62304 phase gate checklist.
Use @quality-manager /soup or @architect /soup-eval to evaluate SOUP dependencies.
Use @cybersec-officer (SecureMax) for threat modeling, SBOM, and CVE audits.
Use @quality-manager /release-check to run the full release readiness checklist.
Use @regulatory-affairs /dhr to assemble the Design History Record.
Use @quality-manager /story-check before and after implementing a story.
Use @clinical-evaluator /ai-validation for AI/ML specific validation (robustness, fairness, OOD).
Use @pms-officer (Dr. Vigil) for Post-Market Surveillance Plan, PMCF, and vigilance.
Use @pms-officer /pmcf to create or update the Post-Market Clinical Follow-up Plan.
Use @pms-officer /psur to prepare the Periodic Safety Update Report.
Use @pms-officer /vigilance to evaluate and report an incident.
Use @pms-officer /drift-analysis to analyze AI/ML performance drift signals.
Use @pms-officer /performance-monitor to configure SaMD AI monitoring.
Use @human-factors (Prof. Didac) /ifu to draft or review Instructions For Use.
Use @human-factors for IEC 62366-1 usability engineering process.
Use @human-factors /formative to plan a formative usability evaluation.
Use @human-factors /summative to plan a summative usability evaluation.
Use @human-factors /training to design user training programs.
Use @human-factors (Prof. Didac) for IEC 62366, IFU, and usability evaluations.
